title: How to Create Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)
description: Document your processes so you can delegate, train helpers, and scale your business.
requirements: A task you do repeatedly that you want to document
Google Docs or similar for storing SOPs

steps.title: Pick a process to document first
steps.description: Start with something you do often.
substeps: Think about tasks you'd want to hand off to a helper
Good first SOPs: Truck loading, job site cleanup, customer walkthrough
Pick something you do at least weekly
Start simple — don't try to document everything at once
steps.tip: If you can't explain it step-by-step, you can't delegate it.

steps.title: Brain dump the steps to ChatGPT
steps.description: Let ChatGPT organize your rough notes into a proper SOP.
substeps: Go to chat.openai.com
Type: 'Help me create an SOP for [task]. Here's what I typically do: [describe the process in your own words, even messily]'
ChatGPT will organize it into clear, numbered steps

steps.title: Review and add details
substeps: Read through each step — does it make sense to someone who's never done it?
Add warnings for common mistakes
Include what 'done right' looks like
Add time estimates for each section

steps.title: Add visuals if helpful
steps.description: A picture is worth a thousand words.
substeps: Take photos of key steps
Record a quick video walkthrough
Screenshots for any software steps
Store in a shared folder (Google Drive works great)
steps.tip: Video SOPs are great for complex physical tasks.

steps.title: Store and organize your SOPs
steps.description: Make them easy to find and update.
substeps: Create a Google Drive folder called 'SOPs'
Name files clearly: 'SOP - Truck Loading' not 'document 1'
Share the folder with employees/helpers
Review and update SOPs every 6 months

steps.title: Test the SOP
steps.description: The real test is whether someone can follow it.
substeps: Have someone else try to follow the SOP
Watch where they get confused or stuck
Ask them what's unclear
Update based on their feedback

successMessage: You created your first SOP! This is how you build a business that can run without you.
proTips: SOPs make training new helpers 10x faster
When you catch yourself saying 'I always do it this way', that's an SOP waiting to be written
Start with 5-10 core SOPs, then add more over time
